page.title: 02BIOGRAPHIES
page.content: { { "Kenton's oldest villager" { }Frank Cumes came to visit class one to talk to us. He was born in September 1887,which means he is 98. His father and grand father came to our school. He started school at the age of seven and left at fourteen. The headmaster was strict;he was fond of giving "six of the best" (the cane) the other teacher whose favourite punishment was sticking a pencil in pupils ears. There were no school dinners but they had bread and sops for breakfast. They had to work on slates at school. All the children were scared of the lunatic assylum across the road. When he left school he became a gardener. He worked 50 hours for 10 shillings(50p). He worked every day of the year except Good Friday and Christmas Day.
